intro: Ruehssia colombiana, commonly known as the Colombian ruehssia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and leathery, elliptical leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
